A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Too long (::way::too long)\, too many superfluous characters\, too many unanswered questions (Rian Johnson told fans curious about Snoke to go pound sand)\, no real lightsaber fights\, too much "across the universe via the Force" expositoin\, too many cutsie animals\, and an insulting treatment of Luke Skywalker (I agree with Mark Hamill's assessment of it not being "his Luke Skywalker").

The script was weak (capital ships "running out of fuel" seems to be the centerpiece of the story\, which is about as compelling as "trade route disagreements").  This is exactly what one would expect when a corporation takes over coming up with movie ideas.  Rian Johnson's ego has run amok in this one\, trying to reinvent the franchise and move it away from its core ideas.

Go watch Rogue One again if you want a Star Wars fix.  It was a true masterpiece that honored the franchise.
